comments.author: stephanie
comments.content: I love gorgonzola in pasta. In Rome I had risotto with pear and gorgonzola and a balsamic reduction.  It was amazing.  Can you try to recreate that one for me? Thanks!

comments.author: easy vegetarian recipes
comments.content: I love pastas but I haven't tried this out.  I will work on this in my kitchen one of these days.

comments.author: Alessandra
comments.content:
I like the idea of smoked asparagus, probably I wouldn't use them with the gorgonzola... pity I am not there to taste your dish, some pairing I like to taste before trying to make them :-)

Ciao
Alessandra

comments.author: Ivy Manning
comments.content: Huh. Never thought of stovetop smoking asparagus, or any other veggie for that matter. I do the indoor smoky thing with pork belly, and duck, and all that jazz. Now I'm thinking all sorts of plants...mushrooms? Every smoked mushrooms this way?

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: I haven't smoked mushrooms this way, but I suspect it would work beautifully. I bet a good move would be to set them in with the gill sides down, seems like that side would be best at absorbing the flavor.

comments.author: Michael
comments.content: I have a favor to ask! I've been looking at your site off and on for a few weeks. I'm a culinary student at South Seattle Community College, and as part of our final project we have to conceptualize and open a restaurant on paper. I realized that my carnivorous teammates managed to pack the menu without a single vegetarian option. Would you mind if we used this recipe? Obviously, we wouldn't be making any money off of it. Thank you!

comments.author: Katherine
comments.content: What a cool technique! I never thought to try smoking at home with so little equipment. Can't wait to try it.
